answers.answer: Yes, Ukrainians and refugees do receive free medical care provided by representatives of the International Organization for Migration in Romania - IOM Romania.
answers.bResponse: Yes, Ukrainians and refugees do receive free medical care provided by representatives of the International Organization for Migration in Romania - IOM Romania. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/free-medical-care-for-refugees-from-ukraine

answers.answer: Yes, they can join the community gardening initiative.
answers.bResponse: Yes, they can join the community gardening initiative. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/free-medical-care-for-refugees-from-ukraine

answers.answer: The representatives of the International Organization for Migration in Romania offer free medical assistance to Ukrainian citizens and individuals from various nations who have sought refuge there. You may contact IOM Romania directly by visiting their official website or calling them at +40 (31) 639-8300 for further information on their programs.

answers.answer: Yes, you need to make an appointment with the IOM representatives before seeing a doctor at RomExpo.
